results.title: The Boy Kumasenu
results.creator_credit: Gold Coast Film Unit, Sean Graham and John Hollingsworth
results.brief_description: Dramatised documentary of a young African boy, Kumasenu, making his way unaided from the tribal world into the twentieth century. He has known no life other than that of a quiet fishing village. Wrongly accused of bringing bad luck to his people he becomes an outcast and an easy prey to the temptations of the city life of which his flash friend Agboh thinks so highly. Until helped by new friends, life for him is bewildering and dangerous.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gold Coast Film Unit, Sean Graham and John Hollingsworth

results.title: The Boy from Coober Pedy
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Eugene Schlusser
results.brief_description: The story of a family who go to live in Coober Pedy, South Australia. Shows the ways in which the family live in, and adapt to, their new environment, initially living in a caravan while their underground home is completed. The excavation and creation of this house, ideally suited to the climate, is shown. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Boy and the snow goose
results.brief_description: A delightful animated story about the friendship between a boy and a snow goose. The call of nature is strong and the essence of the friendship is tested as the boy and the goose must follow their own instincts.

results.title: The Boy and the pelican
results.creator_credit: Wessex Film Productions, Arden Winch and Geoffrey Gurnan
results.brief_description: Pedro a pampered pelican lives happily on a Greek island until the arrival of a small boy called Hiko. Pedro is then forgotten by the islanders. He tries to fly away but is too bloated to succeed. On his return Pedro is seen by Niko who falls in love with him. Pedro is now completely happy.

results.title: The Boy and the North Wind
results.brief_description: A puppet animation film about greed and justice. A young boy receives three presents from the North Wind and each one is stolen by a greedy landlord. Finally the North Wind gives the boy a present that punishes the greedy landlord.

results.title: The Boy and the cat
results.brief_description: An animated children’s Christmas fantasy about the adventures of a boy and his cat. No narration - music only. Suitable for lower and middle primary level.

results.title: The Boy & the island: Christopher Koch, Tasmanian novelist
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and John Muirhead
results.brief_description: A profile of novelist Christopher Koch including readings from his work and beautiful Tasmanian landscape scenes. This program is shot in colour with some black and white sequences and scenes from his novels are performed.

results.title: The Boxer [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Hell's Kitchen, Jim Sheridan and Arthur Lappin
results.brief_description: Danny Flynn (Daniel Day Lewis) has just been released from prison after serving a 14 year sentence for something he didn’t do. Returning to his old neighbourhood, he is re-united with Maggie (Emily Watson), his child hood sweetheart, whose husband is also serving time in jail for his involvement with the IRA. Maggie is desperately unhappy raising her son alone and Danny’s presence brings some light to her depressing life. Danny and Maggie become close once again, much to the anger of their fellow neighbours and friends. Wanting to do something positive with his life, Danny draws on his past experience as a successful boxer and transforms the local community centre into a gym where he can teach the local children boxing. After a bomb goes off at the centre, Danny and Maggie are forced to make a decision about their future. Directed by Jim Sheridan (“In the name of the father”), “The Boxer” shows us the personal impact of Ireland’s political troubles. Also available on VHS [318846].

results.title: The Bowater story
results.creator_credit: Bowater, World Wide Pictures and Arthur Graham
results.brief_description: A story of industrial growth and enterprise - in 1926 the British company Bowater began making paper as well as selling it, and now owns mills and forests in many parts of the world including Norway, Sweden, USA, France, New Zealand and Australia.

results.title: The Bounty
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, De Laurentiis Entertainment Group, Bernard Williams and Roger Donaldson
results.brief_description: A re-telling of the famous conflict between Captain Bligh and Mr. Fletcher Christian aboard the ship “The Bounty”. The conflict eventually led to a mutiny against Bligh, led by Christian, and to Bligh’s miraculous escape in an open boat across 4,000 miles of ocean. Featuring beautiful Pacific locations and a star-studded cast including Daniel Day Lewis, Edward Fox and Laurence Olivier. Mel Gibson plays Christian. But it is Anthony Hopkins’ portrayal of Bligh which is most memorable and he makes the Captain a believably human character rather than the monster he is usually portrayed as. Music by Vangelis. The script is by Robert Bolt based on the book “Captain Bligh and Mr Christian” by Richard Hough.
